item.title: FLAP ISOLATION VALVE (FLAP/SLAT DEPRESSURIZATION MODULE – SHUTOFF FUNCTION) – AIRPLANES NOT EQUIPPED WITH FSAM

remarks.para: May be inoperative open provided FSEUs and by-pass valves are verified to be operative.

placard.para: Placard near EICAS "FLAP ISOLATION VALVE INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Verify that isolation valve is open:
Provide electrical power (Ref. Maintenance Manual 24-22-00).

warning.para: KEEP PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT CLEAR OF ALL CONTROL SURFACES TO PREVENT INJURY OR DAMAGE.

numlitem.para: Pressurize left hydraulic system (Ref. Maintenance Manual 29-11-00).
Verify that flaps respond to flap lever input.
Verify proper operation of bypass valve.
Place flap lever in 1 position.
Open FLAP SLAT SHUTOFF 1 circuit breaker (11H14) and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE identifier.
Ground pin #4 on FSEU data bus test receptacle in the cargo compartment, station 56OR, for at least ten seconds.
Verify "L E SLAT ASYM" message appears on EICAS and amber leading edge light comes on (P3 panel).
Move flap lever to 15.
Verify that there is no flap or slat motion.
Move flap lever to 1.
With an observer watching the slats, press the left and right stall warning test switch.
Verify by observing that there is no slat motion.
Close FLAP SLAT SHUTOFF 1 circuit breaker (11H14) and remove DO-NOT-CLOSE identifier.
Cycle FLAP SLAT ELEC UNIT 1 PWR (G12 on P11 panel) Circuit Breaker to clear "L E SLAT ASYM FAULT".
Verify alternate mode is operational.
Cycle flaps and slats from UP to 1 and 1 to UP by using the TE and LE alternate arming switches and the alternate FLAPS/SLATS switch.
Check that no TE FLAPS DISAGREE or LE SLATS DISAGREE message appears on EICAS.
Verify that all three Flap Slat Electronic Units (FSEU) is operative by performing FSEU BITE procedure (Ref. Maintenance Manual 27-51-00).
Verify all busses are normally powered. Check for FLAP SLAT ELEC status message and FLAP SLAT BITE maintenance message. If either message is displayed, dispatch is not allowed.
